problem:
One line is described by
\[\begin{pmatrix} -20 \\ -18 \\ -6 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ k \\ 9 \end{pmatrix}.\]Another line is described by
\[\begin{pmatrix} -10 \\ -7 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix} + u \begin{pmatrix} 66 \\ 69 \\ 73 \end{pmatrix}.\]Find $k$ so that the lines are coplanar (i.e. there is a plane that contains both lines).
